snippet: The instincts of Hillary Rodham Clinton, the departing secretary of state, were often more activist than those of a White House that has kept a tight grip on foreign policy.
abstract: Interviews with current and former Obama administration officials paint complex picture of outgoing Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton's tenure; disclosures reveal dogged diplomat who prized her role as team player, but whose instincts were often more activist than those of White House that has kept tight grip on foreign policy.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: The instincts of Hillary Rodham Clinton, the departing secretary of state, were often more activist than those of a White House that has kept a tight grip on foreign policy.

headline.seo: In Behind-Scene Blows and Triumphs, Sense of Clinton Future
headline.main: Backstage Glimpses of Clinton as Dogged Diplomat, Win or Lose
headline.print_headline: Backstage Glimpses of Clinton as Dogged Diplomat, Win or Lose

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
